configuration.name: widget_09308430835865549
configuration.stem: Read the description of the reproductive process of coral. Decide if it is an example of sexual reproduction, asexual reproduction, or both asexual and sexual reproduction.

feedBack.firstWrongHint: coral has a two stage reproductive cycle.
feedBack.finalWrongHint: The first stage of coral reproduction is sexual reproduction because sperm and egg unite. The second stage is asexual reproduction in the form of budding.

cells.label: Corals release eggs and sperm into the water. Fertilized eggs develop into larva, which attach to surfaces and grow into polyps (adult corals). New coral polyps can also bud off and remain attached to their parents. Or, part of a coral can break off and grow into a new coral.

configuration.stemImageAlt: In this photograph, a coral reef is surrounded by fish.
